title: Please explain to me in layman's terms what this paragraph means? I have Liens & Creditors. Status: Awaiting Discharge
question: Event Name(s): Chapter 7 Trustee's Report of No Distribution
answers:
The Report of No Distribution is basically the trustee's report to the court the he or she has concluded the investigation in your case and determined that you have nothing of value to be sold for the benefit of your creditors. "Dear Court: There's nothing here and my job is done. Please cut me loose". The likely outcome is that you will receive your discharge in the near future and be able to keep the property you listed if creditors do not file any legal objections to your discharge.

If you haven't taken the second class in financial management, you need to make sure you get it done and file the certificate of completion with the court. Many courts also require a separate declaration from you stating that you took the class. Failure to file this form will result in have having your case closed without a discharge.

The deadline for creditors to objection to your discharge is 60 days after the first meeting of creditors unless extended by a court order. Riverside bankruptcy court is extremely slow, so the discharge might not be entered right away, but that is okay because the automatic stay still protects you.

if you have any further questions, I suggest contacting a bankruptcy attorney in Riverside.
It means that the trustee is no longer interested in your case.

It means the trustee after having conducted your section 341 meeting of creditors and after examining the petition and schedules filed in your case has determined that you have nothing to liquidate for the use and benefit of your creditors. Your discharge should be coming about 60 days after the first setting date of your 341. The trustee is also asking that he be relieved of any further obligation in regard to your case and he listed the various property values of the stuff you listed in your petition and schedules, what you claimed as exempt and if there were any non exempt assets that the trustee chose not to administer because of their minimal value.

it means that , in essence, the ch 7 trustee has no isssues with the case.

when u say liens do u mean levies or secured debt? Either way you should consult with a lawyer.

you can only file (more or less) every 8 years. You should not squander an opportunity.

The trustee in 98% of cases have no assets to sell. When none, they have duty to file that report. About 110 days after filing or so then the court will send out the discharge and close your case about 7 days or more after the discharge date. If you are the debtor and have real estate you are keeping and have judgment liens, you want to speak to an attorney on filing motions to avoid such liens. Good luck,.
It means "Chill"; you are well on your way to a discharge.
